page.title: 13Changing times in St.Albans.
page.content: 2 old people told us about{60 years {of changes.}It is much bigger.The big houses in{St.Peters St.}have gone and it is all shops,while the little bakers,butchers and general stores in places like{St.Michaels}have been turned into houses.Places like{Fish- {pool St.}and St.Michaels were slums, where poor people lived.Now these are the most expensive areas.They remember the blacksmith's,now converted into a 1 bedroom cottage and just sold for Â£65000.There was a{factory }where the modern{Gonnerston houses}are.The vicar of St.Michaels lived in a cottage and the{school}had only 2 classrooms.There were lots{more pubs.}You could{swim}in the{lake}when the men first dug it.{ {King Harry Lane}and {Bluehouse Hill} are now fast,modern roads,then they were narrow leafy lanes.We had 3 stations and there were trams.
